title: Working out text
content:
I'm trying to work out the L and E in my "Luv Ace" ambigram. And/or any other problems you might see.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023203530im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LuvAce_5760.gif)
author: vintagesignman

comments.content: The L looks allright, the u is hard to read (too thin) the E looks to be the only lowercase and is also too light, same with your c. Cool concept though.

Forgive my hack. I thought it might be easier to show you what I mean.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023203530im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hack-LuvAce_5760_3697.gif)

Basically you need to ariculate the stroke endings a bit more. I tweaked the u/c a bit too.

Hack away. I love the u/c, thank you. The problem I have with the L/E is the eye see the L as a backward E too easily. That is the sticky tricky part.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023203530im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LA_3719.gif)
I think it is the middle spur of the L/E pair. If it had more of a curve maybe? On the L down and on the E up?
Thanks, I'll give it a go.
